docs.snippet: At a luncheon celebrating "Inglourious Basterds," Adrian Grenier, Joan Collins and a thrash punk guitarist were among those populating the eclectic guest list....
docs.lead_paragraph: "I love your show," Joan Collins said to Adrian Grenier the other day, at a lunch in an art-filled town house on the Upper East Side.
docs.abstract: At a luncheon celebrating "Inglourious Basterds," Adrian Grenier, Joan Collins and a thrash punk guitarist were among those populating the eclectic guest list.

docs.snippet: As part of their efforts to speed up the Oscars, the telecast's producers will not have the best original song nominees performing. But there will be plenty of dancing....
docs.lead_paragraph: Among the many changes that Bill Mechanic and Adam Shankman, the producers of You've Never Seen the Oscars Like This Before, are instituting to get the program to move along - keeping the speeches short, paring the "introductions to introductions" - one is sure to be unpopular with some members of the Academy. The best original song nominees will not be performing at this year's telecast, according to Nikki Finke.
docs.abstract: As part of their efforts to speed up the Oscars, the telecast's producers will not have the best original song nominees performing. But there will be plenty of dancing.

docs.snippet: A victory for Quentin Tarantino's World War II revenge fantasy seems unlikely, but Harvey Weinstein, unsurprisingly, spies a path to victory....
docs.lead_paragraph: Last week, the Bagger dropped by a Peggy Siegal lunch for "Inglourious Basterds." Held at the art-filled Upper East Side town house of Katharina Otto Bernstein, a German documentary filmmaker, and Nathan Bernstein, a rich person - er, art dealer -- it was hosted by Harvey Keitel and drew a rogue's gallery of cinematic bad boys and aspirants, from F. Murray Abraham to Adrian Grenier. This being the Upper East Side, there were also socialites, who mostly avoided the buffet spread of Wiener schnitzel and fish in favor of cooing over the décor, which included a rooftop pool, a terrarium with a waterfall, plus assorted Picassos, Modiglianis and contemporary Chinese sculpture. Yeah, it was pretty coo-worthy.
docs.abstract: A victory for Quentin Tarantino's World War II revenge fantasy seems unlikely, but Harvey Weinstein, unsurprisingly, spies a path to victory.

headline.main: A Bunch of 'Basterds' for Best Picture?

docs.snippet: The earthquake that hit Haiti on Jan. 12 may have caused between $7.2 billion and $13.2 billion in damage, far above the $5 billion initially estimated....
docs.lead_paragraph: The earthquake that hit Haiti on Jan. 12 may have caused between $7.2 billion and $13.2 billion in damage, far above the $5 billion initially estimated.

headline.main: Estimates of Quake Damage in Haiti Increase by Billions
headline.print_headline: Estimates of Quake Damage In Haiti Increase by Billions

docs.snippet: At this year's Oscar luncheon, there were a few twists, including a democratic seating chart and a live Facebook feed....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Academy's nominees luncheon seems like a perfectly nice occasion for all the contenders to meet and greet, congratulate each other and have their photo taken. At least, that's what it's been in previous years. This year, it was broadcast live on the Academy's Facebook page, which meant it was also an experiment in social media. Between 1,000 and 1,200 people, including the Bagger, watched the stream, which focused not on the stars' tables - where all the good gossip that doesn't take place in the smoking area happens - but on the speeches delivered by the Academy president, Tom Sherak, and the telecast's producers, Bill Mechanic and Adam Shankman.
docs.abstract: At this year's Oscar luncheon, there were a few twists, including a democratic seating chart and a live Facebook feed.

headline.main: Barbara Walters to End Oscar-Night Specials
headline.print_headline: Barbara Walters To End Oscar-Night Specials

byline.original: By BRIAN  STELTER; Compiled by PATRICK HEALY

docs.snippet: Her celebrity sit-downs have been a staple of Academy Awards nights since 1981....
docs.lead_paragraph: Barbara Walters is calling an end to her annual Oscars interview show. Ms. Walters, 77, said Monday on "The View" that this year's "Barbara Walters Special" would be her last. Her celebrity sit-downs have been a staple of Academy Awards nights since 1981. Read more on ArtsBeat...
docs.abstract: Her celebrity sit-downs have been a staple of Academy Awards nights since 1981.
